hero.title: The 2023 Dahas Report: The casualties of Marcos’s “bloodless” drug war
hero.description: The key hotspots for the killings are Davao del Sur, 61; Cebu, 52; Metro Manila, 41; Negros Occidental, 31; and Iloilo, 22.

primary.lead: Charter Change to Amend the 1987 Constitution
primary.title: Charter change through People's Initiative: What is it?
primary.description: There is a renewed push for amending the constitution allegedly through people's initiative. What exactly is people's initiative and how does it work?

secondary.title: <abbr title="People’s Initiative for Reform Modernization and Action">Pirma</abbr> is back: Charter change drive on air, on ground
secondary.description: Manila, Philippines — Television viewers were bombarded on Tuesday night with the repeated airing of a commercial that sought to discredit the Constitution and the Edsa People Power Revolution

secondary.title: How to properly change the Constitution
secondary.description: The issues surrounding the latest attempt at Chacha

secondary.title: Are signatures for charter change being collected in your area?
secondary.description: For the people’s initiative to succeed, signatures of at least 3% of registered voters of every congressional district should be collected

carousel.title: ‘She is a victim’: family begs Indonesia to free Filipino on death row
carousel.description: Drug convict Mary Jane Veloso has been on death row in Indonesia since 2010. Her parents hope President Joko Widodo will grant her freedom as he visits Manila.

carousel.title: Traffic index: 25 mins, 30 secs to travel 10 kms in Metro Manila
carousel.description: Traffic further worsened in Metro Manila in 2023, resulting in an estimated 117 hours – almost five days – lost in traffic congestion last year by every Filipino who had to deal with rush hour every working day.

carousel.title: Sardines surge in Davao
carousel.description: The Bureau of Fisheries and Aquatic Resources-Davao Region (Bfar-Davao Region) reported a significant surge of juvenile sardines, known as lupoy, washing ashore at Km. 11, DavSam Port, Sasa in Davao City for the fourth consecutive day.

carousel.title: Millions of Filipino Catholics join Black Nazarene procession
carousel.description: More than six million Catholic devotees in the Philippines turned up for this year's procession to honour the Black Nazarene, turning the streets of the capital into a sea of maroon and yellow, in a grand display of religious devotion.
